Rich,
When I think of masame hada in tsuba, it's a like a puff pastry crust in the rim and the sukashi.  In your ko_shoami image I think it's a weld between layers and something like masame hada.  I wouldn't consider that tekkotsu.

The owari_mimi doesn't look like masame hada to me.  But most all tsuba forging would result in some sort of masame in the rim.

Jim


  3.  There are running bones and there is masame hada.  The ones that really look like masame hada are just the layers in the iron.  

  Hi Jim, ok, so this is Masame hada ?

  http://www.nihontomessageboard.com/tsuba_collection/owari-mimi.jpg

  and this is a running bone or a fold ?, it goes around 3 sides of the tsuba, mostly unbroken.

  http://www.nihontomessageboard.com/tsuba_collection/ko_shoami_bones.jpg

  cheers

  Rich
